pull.title: BIP85: revert XPRV breaking changes for application 32'
pull.body:
* revert (only) breaking changes wrt XPRV (application 32')
* no need to mention `0x00` private key prepend as it is defined in BIP-032

events.message: rever XPRV breaking changes for application 32'

events.body: ACK - we should never break user space, if someone has an alternative implementation it can go in a different bip

rename.from: rever XPRV breaking changes for application 32'
rename.to: BIP85: revert XPRV breaking changes for application 32'

events.body: The reference implementations section would also need to be reverted.

> The reference implementations section would also need to be reverted.

I've done a full revert in #1674.

From https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1600#issuecomment-2394691135:

> Although the BIP is still in Draft status, I think it should have been marked as proposed or final a long time ago as it does appear to be deployed by a few projects.

@scgbckbone would you like to update this pull to do that instead?

closing this - as full revert already merged https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1674

thanks @jonatack

> > The reference implementations section would also need to be reverted.
> 
> I've done a full revert in #1674.
> 
> From [#1600 (comment)](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1600#issuecomment-2394691135):
> 
> > Although the BIP is still in Draft status, I think it should have been marked as proposed or final a long time ago as it does appear to be deployed by a few projects.
> 
> @scgbckbone would you like to update this pull to do that instead?

created new PR instead https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1676

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -438,8 +439,7 @@ BIP32, BIP39
 
 * 1.0 (2020-07)
 * 2.0.0 (2024-09-22)
-    * Swap chain code and private key bytes in application 32' for consistentcy with BIP-32 (major change)
-    * Correct derived entropy for application 128169' test vector (major change)
+    * Correct derived entropy for application 707764' test vector (bugfix)
comments.body: @akarve I assume this was bug in application number ? you mentioned `128169'` in previous [PR](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1600) BUT wrong entropy was in `707764'`. I see no breaking changes in hex app

comments.diff_hunk: @@ -239,9 +239,10 @@ OUTPUT ===XPRV=== Application number: 32' -Consistent with BIP32, use the first (leftmost) 32 bytes of the derived entropy as the -private key. Prepend an empty byte (0x00) -per BIP32 on master key serialization. Use the last (rightmost) 32 bytes as the chain code. +Taking 64 bytes of the HMAC digest, the first 32 bytes are the chain code, +and second 32 bytes are the private key for BIP32 XPRV value. + +WARNING: This is not consistent with BIP-032
comments.body:
a3ff1eacfa290fd559f1fa8b8d396890e568881c nit, may as well use the same convention as the rest of this BIP, not a blocker

```suggestion
WARNING: This is not consistent with BIP32
```
Verified this change indeed reverts to the previous xprv in https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1600/files#diff-eae7a61b6d2a0b6091c1ce04618f216cbb871d987b985ba712de89e04014654cL235.

comments.diff_hunk: @@ -239,9 +239,10 @@ OUTPUT ===XPRV=== Application number: 32' -Consistent with BIP32, use the first (leftmost) 32 bytes of the derived entropy as the -private key. Prepend an empty byte (0x00) -per BIP32 on master key serialization. Use the last (rightmost) 32 bytes as the chain code. +Taking 64 bytes of the HMAC digest, the first 32 bytes are the chain code, +and second 32 bytes are the private key for BIP32 XPRV value.
comments.body:
In a3ff1eacfa290fd559f1fa8b8d396890e568881c, is there a reason not to keep the previous footnote at https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1600/files#diff-eae7a61b6d2a0b6091c1ce04618f216cbb871d987b985ba712de89e04014654cL379?

```suggestion
and second 32 bytes[1] are the private key for BIP32 XPRV value.
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -438,8 +439,7 @@ BIP32, BIP39
 
 * 1.0 (2020-07)
 * 2.0.0 (2024-09-22)
-    * Swap chain code and private key bytes in application 32' for consistentcy with BIP-32 (major change)
-    * Correct derived entropy for application 128169' test vector (major change)
+    * Correct derived entropy for application 707764' test vector (bugfix)
comments.body:
The only vector that needs correction as of my simplified PR #1679 is [Hex (128169')](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1679/files#diff-eae7a61b6d2a0b6091c1ce04618f216cbb871d987b985ba712de89e04014654cR264).

If somehow an extant implementation got the old test vector to work this correction would be a breaking change but I agree that if the correct BIP 85 algo is used then this is non-breaking :)
